A1.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, mix and serve over ice into a chilled glass.

Ace.strInstructions: Shake all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker and ice then strain in a cold glass.

Adam.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

AT&T.strInstructions: Pour Vodka and Gin over ice, add Tonic and Stir

ACID.strInstructions: Poor in the 151 first followed by the 101 served with a Coke or Dr Pepper chaser.

A. J..strInstructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Affair.strInstructions: Pour schnapps, orange juice, and cranberry juice over ice in a highball glass. Top with club soda and serve.

Avalon.strInstructions: Fill a tall glass with ice. Layer the Finlandia Vodka, lemon and apple juices, Pisang Ambon, and top up with lemonade. Stir slightly and garnish with a spiralled cucumber skin and a red cherry. The cucumber provides zest and looks attractive. This drink, created by Timo Haimi, took first prize in the 1991 Finlandia Vodka Long Drink Competition.

Abilene.strInstructions: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

Almeria.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Addison.strInstructions: Shake together all the ingredients and strain into a cold glass.

Acapulco.strInstructions: Combine and shake all ingredients (except mint) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the sprig of mint and serve.

Affinity.strInstructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Applecar.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Aviation.strInstructions: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

Alexander.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

Algonquin.strInstructions: Combine and shake all ingredients with ice,  strain contents into a cocktail glass,  and serve.

Allegheny.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the twist of lemon peel and serve.

Artillery.strInstructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Autodafé.strInstructions: Mix and fill up with soda water. Drunk by finns on a sunny day any time of the year and day.

Afternoon.strInstructions: Build into a suiting glass, with no ice. Cream on top if wanted. Served directly.

After sex.strInstructions: Pour the vodka and creme over some ice cubes in a tall glass and fill up with juice. to make it beuty full make the top of the glass with a grenadine and sugar

B-53.strInstructions: Layer the Kahlua, Sambucca and Grand Marnier into a shot glas in that order. Better than B-52

B-52.strInstructions: Layer ingredients into a shot glass. Serve with a stirrer.

Bijou.strInstructions: Stir in mixing glass with ice and strain

Boxcar.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

Big Red.strInstructions: Pour ingredients into 1 ounce shot glass

Bellini.strInstructions: Pour peach purée into chilled flute, add sparkling wine. Stir gently.

Bramble.strInstructions: Fill glass with crushed ice. Build gin, lemon juice and simple syrup over. Stir, and then pour blackberry liqueur over in a circular fashion to create marbling effect. Garnish with two blackberries and lemon slice.

Balmoral.strInstructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Bluebird.strInstructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine the gin, triple sec, Curacao, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist and the cherry.

Brooklyn.strInstructions: Combine ingredients with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Boomerang.strInstructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, bitters, and maraschino liqueur. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.

Barracuda.strInstructions: Shake pour ingredients with ice. Strain into glass, top with Sparkling wine.

Buccaneer.strInstructions: Pour the corona into an 18oz beer glass pour the bacardi limon into the beer stir very gently

Brigadier.strInstructions: Mix ingredients in a warmed mug and stir.

Broadside.strInstructions: Half fill the glass with ice cubes. Crush the wormwood and add to ice. Pour rum, scotch and butters, then serve!

Blackthorn.strInstructions: Stir sloe gin and vermouth with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

Bob Marley.strInstructions: Layer in a 2 oz shot glass or pony glass

Bubble Gum.strInstructions: Layer in order into a shot glass.

Bible Belt.strInstructions: Mix all ingredients, and pour over ice.

Brain Fart.strInstructions: Mix all ingredients together. Slowly and gently. Works best if ice is added to punch bowl and soda's are very cold.

Bloody Mary.strInstructions: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.

Blue Lagoon.strInstructions: Pour vodka and curacao over ice in a highball glass. Fill with lemonade, top with the cherry, and serve.

Boston Sour.strInstructions: Shake juice of lemon, powdered sugar, blended whiskey, and egg white with cracked ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

Brandy Flip.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the brandy, egg, sugar, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the nutmeg.

Casino.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a maraschino cherry. Serve without a straw.

Caipirinha.strInstructions: Place lime and sugar into old fashioned glass and muddle (mash the two ingredients together using a muddler or a wooden spoon). Fill the glass with ice and add the Cachaça.

Cherry Rum.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Cuba Libre.strInstructions: Build all ingredients in a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

Cuba Libra.strInstructions: Fill tall glass with ice cubes. Add rum. Rub cut edge of lime on rim of glass then squeeze juice into glass. Fill with Coca-Cola. Garnish with lime slice. Enjoy!

Cafe Savoy.strInstructions: Fill mug almost to top with coffee.Add milk, triple sec and brandy. Stir.

Cream Soda.strInstructions: Pour 1oz of Spiced Rum into a highball glass with ice. Fill with Ginger Ale.

Corn n Oil.strInstructions: Cut the half lime in half again. Add the lime, falernum, and bitters to a rocks glass. Muddle. Add the rum. (Aged Barbados rum such as Plantation 5 Year is recommended). Add ice and stir. Float the blackstrap rum on top. Serve with a straw.

Casa Blanca.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Clover Club.strInstructions: Dry shake ingredients to emulsify, add ice, shake and served straight up.

Citrus Coke.strInstructions: Pour half of coke in a glass. Then add Bacardi and top it off with the remaining coke. Stir and drink up!

Chicago Fizz.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

City Slicker.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Coffee-Vodka.strInstructions: Boil water and sugar until dissolved. Turn off heat. Slowly add dry instant coffee and continue stirring. Add a chopped vanilla bean to the vodka, then combine the cooled sugar syrup and coffee solution with the vodka. Cover tightly and shake vigorously each day for 3 weeks. Strain and filter. Its also best to let the sugar mixture cool completely so the vodka won't evaporate when its added. If you like a smoother feel to the liqueur you can add about 1 teaspoon of glycerine to the finished product.

Caipirissima.strInstructions: Same as Caipirinha but instead of cachaca you add WHITE RUM. It's great!!!!!!!!

Campari Beer.strInstructions: Use a 15 oz glass. Add Campari first. Fill with beer.

Cosmopolitan.strInstructions: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and double strain into large cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wheel.

Casino Royale.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

Clove Cocktail.strInstructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Coffee Liqueur.strInstructions: Combine coffee, sugar and water. Simmer 1 hour and let cool. Add vanilla and vodka. Age in sealed jar 2 to 3 weeks.

Chocolate Milk.strInstructions: Put the milk in the bottom, pour the Liquer on top and add the dash of amaretto. Do not mix. SLAM IT!

Creme de Menthe.strInstructions: Bring sugar and water to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Cool. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and let ripen for 1 month.

Derby.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice. Stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint in the drink.

Diesel.strInstructions: Pour the lager first then add the blackcurrant cordial. Top up with the cider. The colour sholud be very dark approaching the colour of Guiness.

Daiquiri.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

Danbooka.strInstructions: pour it in and mix it.

Dragonfly.strInstructions: In a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and ginger ale. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.

Downshift.strInstructions: Start with the Sprite. Next comes the tequila. After that, add the Minute Maid Fruit Punch, then float the 151. Rocks optional.

Dry Rob Roy.strInstructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

Dry Martini.strInstructions: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

Dirty Nipple.strInstructions: This is a layered shot - the Bailey's must be on top

Dirty Martini.strInstructions:
Pour the vodka, dry vermouth and olive brine into a cocktail shaker with a handful of ice and shake well.
Rub the rim of a martini glass with the wedge of lemon.
Strain the contents of the cocktail shaker into the glass and add the olive.
A dirty Martini contains a splash of olive brine or olive juice and is typically garnished with an olive.

Darkwood Sling.strInstructions: There are many good cherry liqueurs you can use, but I prefere Heering. Add one share of the liqueur. Then you add one share of Soda. For a sour sling use Tonic (most people prefer the drink without Tonic). Afterwards you fill the glass with Orange Juice and ice cubes.

Dark Caipirinha.strInstructions:
Muddle the sugar into the lime wedges in an old-fashioned glass.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Pour the cachaca into the glass.
Stir well.

Duchamp's Punch.strInstructions:
Shake all ingredients.
Double strain in a chilled double old fashioned glass with abig ice cube.
Garnish with a couple of lavender sprigs

Dark and Stormy.strInstructions: In a highball glass filled with ice add 6cl dark rum and top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wedge.

Damned if you do.strInstructions: Pour into shot glass. Put in mouth. Repeat as deemed necessary.

Dubonnet Cocktail.strInstructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

Egg Nog #4.strInstructions: In a small mixer bowl beat egg yolks till blended. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating at high speed till thick and lemon colored. Stir in milk, stir in rum, bourbon, vanilla, and salt. Chill thoroughly. Whip cream. Wash beaters well. In a large mixer bowl beat egg whites till soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar, beating to stiff peaks. Fold yolk mixture and whipped cream into egg whites. Serve immediately. Sprinkle nutmeg over each serving. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl. NOTE: For a nonalcoholic eggnog, prepare Eggnog as above, except omit the bourbon and rum and increase the milk to 3 cups.

English Highball.strInstructions: Pour brandy, gin, and sweet vermouth into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water. Add the twist of lemon peel, stir, and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)

Espresso Martini.strInstructions: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake vigorously, and strain into chilled martini glass

Espresso Rumtini.strInstructions: Mix together in a cocktail glass. Garnish with some choclate powder and coffee beans

Egg Nog - Healthy.strInstructions: Whip egg substitute and sugar together, combine with the two kinds of milk, vanilla, and rum. Mix well. Chill over night. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Makes 6 servings.

English Rose Cocktail.strInstructions: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim of glass in powdered sugar. Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into sugar-rimmed glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

Egg-Nog - Classic Cooked.strInstructions: In large saucepan, beat together eggs, sugar and salt, if desired. Stir in 2 cups of the milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat a metal spoon and reaches 160 degrees F. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 2 cups milk and vanilla. Cover and regfigerate until thoroughly chilled, several hours or overnight. Just before serving, pour into bowl or pitcher. Garnish or add stir-ins, if desired. Choose 1 or several of: Chocolate curls, cinnamon sticks, extracts of flavorings, flavored brandy or liqueur, fruit juice or nectar, ground nutmeg, maraschino cherries, orange slices, peppermint sticks or candy canes, plain brandy, run or whiskey, sherbet or ice-cream, whipping cream, whipped. Serve immediately.

Empellón Cocina's Fat-Washed Mezcal.strInstructions:
To ensure that your pork fat is just as delicious as theirs, here’s their adobo marinade and what to do with it (you’ll also need a rack of ribs):

4 ancho chiles, 8 guajillo chiles and 4 chipotle chiles, plus 4 cloves roasted garlic, half a cup of cider vinegar, a quarter teaspoon of Mexican oregano, 1 teaspoon of ground black pepper, a whole clove, a quarter teaspoon of ground cinnamon and a half teaspoon of ground cumin.

Toast the dried chiles and soak in water for at least an hour until they are rehydrated. Drain and discard the soaking liquid. Combine the soaked chiles with the remaining ingredients and purée until smooth.

Cold smoke a rack of baby back pork ribs by taking a large hotel pan with woodchips on one side and charcoal on the other. Place another, smaller, pan with pork ribs, above the charcoal/woodchip pan. Ignite the charcoal, being careful to not ignite the woodchips. Cover both pans with foil and allow to smoke for 10-15 minutes, until desired level of smoke is achieved, then coat with adobo marinade and wrap in tin foil prior to placing ribs in a 300 degree oven for 7 hours. When the ribs have cooled, strain off the fat and use for the infusion.

If you’re having a hard time coming up to the same kind of volume of fat, make up the balance with pork lard from a butcher. To get the same depth of flavor without the ribs, heat up the fat in a pot with a few spoons of the marinade.

Once you’ve got your tub of seasoned pork fat in cooled liquid form, pour equal amounts of Ilegal Joven mezcal and fat into a sealable container. Seal the container and give it a really good shake, then put it in the freezer overnight. When the whole thing is separated and congealed, pour it through a fine mesh chinoise. If you don’t have a chinoise, try a fine mesh strainer, or if you don’t have one of those, try spooning off most of the fat. There will be some beads of orange fat left in the strained mezcal: run that through a few layers of cheesecloth (or coffee filters in a pinch) to get rid of the last of it.

The mezcal is now ready for drinking, straight-up or in a cocktail. 

Habanero tincture

Slice habaneros and add 2 ounces Ilegal Joven mezcal.
Allow to sit overnight or until desired level of heat is achieved.
Cocktail

Combine mezcal and chocolate liqueur in a mixing glass with ice and stir for 45 seconds.
Strain into chilled coupe.
Carefully "sink" the coffee liqueur down the inside of the coupe over a spoon.
Garnish with 5 drops habanero tincture.

Foxy Lady.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

French 75.strInstructions: Combine gin, sugar, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.

Frisco Sour.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except slices of lemon and lime) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the slices of lemon and lime and serve.

Freddy Kruger.strInstructions: make it an ample size shot!!

Fuzzy Asshole.strInstructions: fill coffe mug half full of coffee. Fill the other half full of Peach Schnapps. Stir and drink while hot.

French Martini.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink.

French Negroni.strInstructions:
Add ice to a shaker and pour in all ingredients.
Using a bar spoon, stir 40 to 45 revolutions or until thoroughly chilled.
Strain into a martini glass or over ice into a rocks glass. Garnish with orange twist.

Flying Dutchman.strInstructions: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and triple sec. Stir well.

Frozen Daiquiri.strInstructions: Combine all ingredients (except for the cherry) in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for five seconds, then blend at a high speed until firm. Pour contents into a champagne flute, top with the cherry, and serve.

Fahrenheit 5000.strInstructions: Cover bottom of shot glass with Tabasco Sauce and then fill with half Firewater and half Absolut Peppar.

Flying Scotchman.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

French Connection.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Flaming Dr. Pepper.strInstructions: Add Amaretto, Bacardi, and vodka. Mix in the Dr. Pepper and beer

Flaming Lamborghini.strInstructions: Pour the Sambuca and Kahlua into the Cocktail Glass and give the drinker a straw. Pour the Baileys and Blue Curacao into two sepsrate shot glasses either side of the cocktail glass. Set light the concotion in the cocktail glass and start to drink through the straw (this drink should be drunk in one) , as the bottom of the glass is reached put out the fire by pouring the Baileys and Blue Curacao into the cocktail glass and keep drinking till it's all gone!!

Frozen Mint Daiquiri.strInstructions: Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and serve.

Frozen Pineapple Daiquiri.strInstructions: Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a cocktail glass and serve.

GG.strInstructions: Pour the Galliano liqueur over ice. Fill the remainder of the glass with ginger ale and thats all there is to it. You now have a your very own GG.

Gimlet.strInstructions:
Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.

Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass or an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.

Garnish with a lime wheel.

Gin Fizz.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice cubes, except soda water. Pour into glass. Top with soda water.

Gin Sour.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

Godchild.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.

Gin Daisy.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, sugar, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.

Gin Sling.strInstructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in mixture of water and juice of lemon. Add gin. Pour into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

Gin Smash.strInstructions: Muddle sugar with carbonated water and mint sprigs in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and 1 ice cube. Stir, add the orange slice and the cherry, and serve.

Gin Toddy.strInstructions: Mix powdered sugar and water in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and one ice cube. Stir, add the twist of lemon peel, and serve.

Godfather.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Godmother.strInstructions: Pour vodka and amaretto into an old-fashioned glass over ice and serve.

Gagliardo.strInstructions: Shake well and serve in a cocktail glass. This is a home cocktail of American/Internet Bar del Pozzo, Pavia, Italy.

Gluehwein.strInstructions: Boil sugar and spices in water, leave in the water for 30 minutes. Strain the spiced water and mix with the wine. Heat slowly until short of boiling temperature. (To remove alcohol, let it boil for a while.) You may add lemon or orange juice to taste. Serve in irish coffee cup.

Greyhound.strInstructions:
Add the vodka to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Top with grapefruit juice and stir.

Gin Cooler.strInstructions: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice and add gin. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end of the orange spiral dangles over rim of glass.

Gin Squirt.strInstructions: Stir gin, grenadine, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with the pineapple chunks and the strawberries and serve.

Grand Blue.strInstructions: Serve in an old fashioned glass.

Gin Rickey.strInstructions: Half-fill a tall glass with ice. Mix the gin and Grenadine together and pour over the ice. Add the lime or lemon juice and top off with soda water. Decorate the glass with lime and/or lemon slices.

Gin Swizzle.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the lime juice, sugar, gin, and bitters. Shake well. Almost fill a colling glass with ice cubes. Stir until the glass is frosted. Strain the mixture in the shaker into the glass and add the club soda.

Grass Skirt.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, triple sec, pineapple juice, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the pineapple slice.

Grim Reaper.strInstructions: Mix Kahlua and 151 in glass. Quickly add ice and pour grenadine over ice to give ice red tint.

Grasshopper.strInstructions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake briskly and then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Grizzly Bear.strInstructions: Served over ice. Sounds nasty, but tastes great.

Golden dream.strInstructions: Shake with cracked ice. Strain into glass and serve.

H.D..strInstructions: Mix the whisky and Baileys Cream in a beer-glass (at least 50 cl). Fill the rest of the glass with coffee.

Herbal flame.strInstructions: Pour Hot Damn 100 in bottom of a jar or regular glass. Fill the rest of the glass with sweet tea. Stir with spoon, straw, or better yet a cinnamon stick and leave it in.

Horse's Neck.strInstructions: Pour brandy and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon zest. If desired, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.

Happy Skipper.strInstructions: Pour Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum over ice, fill glass to top with Ginger Ale. Garnish with lime. Tastes like a cream soda. Named for the Gilligan's Island reference ("The Captain" *in* "Ginger" is a Happy Skipper!)

Hunter's Moon.strInstructions: Put the Bombay Sapphire, Martini Bianco, sugar syrup & blackberries in a cocktail shaker with lots of ice and shake vigorously before pouring into a balloon glass, topping up with lemonade and garnishing with a wedge of orange.

Havana Cocktail.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Homemade Kahlua.strInstructions: Dissolve sugar in 2 cups of boiling water and add corn syrup. Dissolve the instant coffee in the remaining water. Pour syrup and coffee in a gallon jug. Let it cool. Add vodka and vanilla when cold. For the best result, let the mixture "mature" for 4-5 weeks.

Halloween Punch.strInstructions:
Tip the cherry juice, orange peel, chilli, cinnamon sticks, cloves and ginger into a large saucepan. Simmer for 5 mins, then turn off the heat. Leave to cool, then chill for at least 4 hrs, or up to 2 days – the longer you leave it the more intense the flavours. If serving to young children, take the chilli out after a few hours.

When you’re ready to serve, pour the juice into a jug. Serve in glass bottles or glasses and pop a straw in each. If you're adding vodka, do so at this stage. Dangle a fangs sweet from each glass.

Harvey Wallbanger.strInstructions: Stir the vodka and orange juice with ice in the glass, then float the Galliano on top. Garnish and serve.

Hawaiian Cocktail.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Hemingway Special.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake.

Highland Fling Cocktail.strInstructions: Stir all ingredients (except olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.

Irish Cream.strInstructions: Mix scotch and milk. Add half-and-half. Add rest.

Ice Pick #1.strInstructions: Put Vodka in glass fill with iced tea. Stir in lemon to taste.

Irish Spring.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients (except orange slice and cherry) into a collins glass over ice cubes. Garnish with the slice of orange, add the cherry on top, and serve.

Irish Coffee.strInstructions: Heat the coffee, whiskey and sugar; do not boil. Pour into glass and top with cream; serve hot.

Imperial Fizz.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

Irish Russian.strInstructions: Add the ingredients in the order listed in the recipe. Care must be taken when adding the Guinness to prevent an excess of foam. Do Not add ice.

Imperial Cocktail.strInstructions: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

Iced Coffee Fillip.strInstructions: Mix together in a coffee mug and chill before serving.

Irish Curdling Cow.strInstructions: Pour Irish Cream, Vodka, and Bourbon in a glass. Add some ice and mix in the orange juice.

Jitterbug.strInstructions: Wet glass, dip rim in sugar. Then add Ice. Then add everything else. It's that simple!

Jam Donut.strInstructions: Coat the rim of a shot glass with sugar using sugar syrup to stick. Add the Chambord raspberry liqueur to the shot glass, and carefully layer the Baileys Irish Cream on top. Serve.

Jelly Bean.strInstructions: mix equal parts in pony glass-tastes just like a jelly bean!

Jello shots.strInstructions: Boil 3 cups of water then add jello. Mix jello and water until jello is completely disolved. Add the two cups of vodka and mix together. Pour mixture into plastic shot glasses and chill until firm. Then, eat away...

John Collins.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients directly into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish. Add a dash of Angostura bitters.

Jamaica Kiss.strInstructions: Fill a tumbler with ice cubes. Add a shot of Tia Maria and a shot of Jamaican light rum. Fill the tumbler with milk. Blend until smooth and serve immediately.

Japanese Fizz.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

Jamaican Coffee.strInstructions: Stir the rum, coffee and water together. Top with the whipped cream. Sprinkle with a pinch of well ground coffee and drink with a straw.

Jewel Of The Nile.strInstructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Jack Rose Cocktail.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Jack's Vanilla Coke.strInstructions: After pouring in your ingredients, and adding 3-5 ice cubes, according to taste. Stir the drink with a stirrer to get the Vanilla off the bottom.

Kir.strInstructions: Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up with wine.

Karsk.strInstructions: Put a copper coin in a coffe-cup and fill up with coffee until you no longer see the coin, then add alcohol until you see the coin. Norwegian speciality.

Kamikaze.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients together with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

Kir Royale.strInstructions: Pour Creme de cassis in glass, gently pour champagne on top

Kurant Tea.strInstructions: Pour Absolut Kurant into a comfortably big tea-cup. Add the not too hot(!) apple tea and, if you like, some sugar. Enjoy!

Kiwi Lemon.strInstructions: Mix in highball glass. Stirr. Garnish with slice of kiwi.

Kioki Coffee.strInstructions: Stir. Add whipped cream to the top.

Kool-Aid Shot.strInstructions: Pour into a large glass with ice and stir. Add a little cranberry juice to taste.

Kool First Aid.strInstructions: Add Kool Aid to a double shot glass, and top with rum. Slam and shoot.

Kentucky B And B.strInstructions: Pour the bourbon and Benedictine into a brandy snifter.

Kentucky Colonel.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes combine the courbon and Benedictine. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

Kool-Aid Slammer.strInstructions: Fill half the shot glass with the kool-aid first. Then put a paper towel over the top of the glass and slowly pour in the vodka. If you do it right, you should be able to see that the two liquids are separated, with the vodka on top. Now slam it! The last thing you'll taste is the kool-aid.

Lunch Box.strInstructions: Fill a pint glass almost full with beer. Then fill the rest with orange juice (careful not to fill it to the top). Then take the shot of Amaretto and drop it in.

Lemon Shot.strInstructions: Mix Galliano and Absolut Citron in a shot glass, lay lemon wedge sprinkled with sugar over glass and pour a rum over wedge and glass. light rum with a lighter and let burn for a second. Do shot quickly and suck on lemon. If it is done correctly, this will taste like a shot of sweet lemonade.

Long vodka.strInstructions: Shake a tall glass with ice cubes and Angostura, coating the inside of the glass. Por the vodka onto this, add 1 slice of lime and squeeze juice out of remainder, mix with tonic, stir and voila you have a Long Vodka

Lemon Drop.strInstructions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with sugar.

Loch Lomond.strInstructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, Drambuie, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

London Town.strInstructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Lord And Lady.strInstructions: Pour the rum and Tia Maria into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

Limona Corona.strInstructions: Open the Corona. Fill the empty space in the neck in the bottle with the rum. The bottle should be filled to the top. Plug the bottle with your thumb or the palm of your hand. Turn the bottle upside-down so the rum and beer mix. Turn the bottle rightside-up, unplug, and drink.

Lady Love Fizz.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

Long Island Tea.strInstructions: Combine all ingredients (except cola) and pour over ice in a highball glass. Add the splash of cola for color. Decorate with a slice of lemon and serve.

Lone Tree Cooler.strInstructions: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice, add gin and vermouth, and stir. Fill with carbonated water and stir again. Add the twist of lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end dangles over rim of glass.

Lone Tree Cocktail.strInstructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Long Island Iced Tea.strInstructions: Mix all contents in a highball glass and sitr gently. Add dash of Coca-Cola for the coloring and garnish with lemon or lime twist.

Mojito.strInstructions: Muddle mint leaves with sugar and lime juice. Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with cracked ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Garnish and serve with straw.

Mimosa.strInstructions: Ensure both ingredients are well chilled, then mix into the glass. Serve cold.

Mai Tai.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into glass. Garnish and serve with straw.

Martini.strInstructions: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

Margarita.strInstructions: Rub the rim of the glass with the lime slice to make the salt stick to it. Take care to moisten only the outer rim and sprinkle the salt on it. The salt should present to the lips of the imbiber and never mix into the cocktail. Shake the other ingredients with ice, then carefully pour into the glass.

Manhattan.strInstructions: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.

Mojito #3.strInstructions: Put mint with lemon juice in a glas, mash the mint with a spoon, ice, rum & fill up with club soda. Top it with Angostura.

Miami Vice.strInstructions: First: Mix pina colada with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice(set aside). Second: Mix daiquiri with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice. Third: While frozen, add pina colda mix then daiquiri mix in glass (Making sure they do not get mixed together).

Mudslinger.strInstructions: Add all contents to a large jug or punch bowl. Stir well!

Moranguito.strInstructions: first you put rhe absinthe, then put tequila, then put the Granadine syrup.

Mint Julep.strInstructions: In a highball glass gently muddle the mint, sugar and water. Fill the glass with cracked ice, add Bourbon and stir well until the glass is well frosted. Garnish with a mint sprig.

Martinez 2.strInstructions:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.

Stir until chilled, and strain into a chilled coupe glass.

Mulled Wine.strInstructions: Simmer 3 cups water with, sugar, cloves, cinnamon sticks, and lemon peel in a stainless steel pot for 10 minutes. Add wine heat to a "coffee temperature" (DO NOT BOIL) then add the brandy.

Moscow Mule.strInstructions: Combine vodka and ginger beer in a highball glass filled with ice. Add lime juice. Stir gently. Garnish.

Mocha-Berry.strInstructions: pour 6 oz. of coffee in a mug or Irish coffee cup. add coca mix and chambord, mix well and top off with whipped cream.

Munich Mule.strInstructions:
Fill glass with ice
Pour Gin and Lime Juice
Fill glass with Ginger Beer
Garnish with Cucumer and Lime slice

Monkey Gland.strInstructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Monkey Wrench.strInstructions: Pour all of the ingredients into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

Midnight Manx.strInstructions: Fill a mixer with ice and add Baileys, Kahlua, Goldshlager, and cream. Shake for 5 seconds and Strain into a double rocks glass filled with ice. Add chilled coffee Stir and enjoy!

Mother's Milk.strInstructions: Shake over ice, strain. Serves two.

Midnight Mint.strInstructions: If available, rim cocktail (Martini) glass with sugar syrup then dip into chocolate flakes or powder. Add ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake well then strain into cocktail glass.

Mary Pickford.strInstructions: Shake and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass

Malibu Twister.strInstructions: Add rum & trister then, add cranberry jucie,stir

Negroni.strInstructions: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

New York Sour.strInstructions: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Float claret on top. Decorate with the half-slice of lemon and the cherry and serve.

National Aquarium.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker of ice. Shake well. Serve on the rocks.

New York Lemonade.strInstructions: Serve in a chilled cocktail glass. Lemon and sugar the rim. Stir and Strain.

Orgasm.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

Old Pal.strInstructions: Chill cocktail glass. Add ingredients to a mixing glass, and fill 2/3 full with ice. Stir about 20 seconds. Empty cocktail glass and strain into the glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel.

Orange Whip.strInstructions: Pour ingredients over ice and stir.

Orange Oasis.strInstructions: Shake brandy, gin, and orange juice with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.

Orange Crush.strInstructions: Add all ingredients to tumbler-Pour as shot

Old Fashioned.strInstructions:
Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitters, add a dash of plain water. Muddle until dissolved.
Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey.

Garnish with orange twist, and a cocktail cherry.

Oreo Mudslide.strInstructions: Blend Vodka, Kahlua, Bailey's, ice-cream and the Oreo well in a blender. Pour into a large frosted glass. Garnish with whipped cream and a cherry.

Orange Push-up.strInstructions: Combine liquors in a blender. Add a half scoop of ice and blend. Garnish with an orange and cherry flag. So good it will melt in your mouth!!!

Oatmeal Cookie.strInstructions:
Just mix it all together.
It's meant to be a shot, but it works just fine as a proper adult-sized drink over lots of ice.

Tastes like an oatmeal cookie.

Owen's Grandmother's Revenge.strInstructions: Add ingredients and mix in blender.

Paloma.strInstructions: Stir together and serve over ice.

Pink Gin.strInstructions: Pour the bitters into a wine glass. Swirl the glass to coat the inside with the bitters, shake out the excess. Pour the gin into the glass. Do not add ice.

Paradise.strInstructions: Shake together over ice. Strain into cocktail glass and serve chilled.

Pink Lady.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Pisco Sour.strInstructions: Vigorously shake and strain contents in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then pour into glass and garnish with bitters.

Porto flip.strInstructions: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

Penicillin.strInstructions: Shake blended Scotch, lemon juice, honey syrup and ginger syrup with ice. Strain over large ice in chilled rocks glass. Float smoky Scotch on top (be sure to use a smoky Scotch such as an Islay single malt). Garnish with candied ginger.

Pina Colada.strInstructions: Mix with crushed ice in blender until smooth. Pour into chilled glass, garnish and serve.

Pink Penocha.strInstructions: mix all ingredients into bowl keep iced stir frequently

Popped cherry.strInstructions: Served over ice in a tall glass with a popped cherry (can add more popped cherries if in the mood)!

Poppy Cocktail.strInstructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Port Wine Flip.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

Planter's Punch.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients, except the bitters, into shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Pour into large glass, filled with ice. Add Angostura bitters, "on top". Garnish with cocktail cherry and pineapple.

Port And Starboard.strInstructions: Pour carefully into a pousse-cafe glass, so that creme de menthe floats on grenadine. Serve without mixing.

Port Wine Cocktail.strInstructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Passion Fruit Martini.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients into a glass and stir. Garnish with half a passion fruit piece.

Quentin.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, Kahlua, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the nutmeg.

Queen Bee.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Quick F**K.strInstructions: In a shot glass add 1/3 Kahlua first. Then 1/3 Miduri, topping it off with a 1/3 bailey's irish cream

Quick-sand.strInstructions: Simply add the orange juice, quite a quick pour in order to mix the sambucca with the orange juice. The juice MUST have fruit pulp!

Queen Charlotte.strInstructions: Pour red wine and grenadine into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with lemon-lime soda, stir, and serve.

Queen Elizabeth.strInstructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Quaker's Cocktail.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Quarter Deck Cocktail.strInstructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Rose.strInstructions: Shake together in a cocktail shaker, then strain into chilled glass. Garnish and serve.

Radler.strInstructions: Pour beer into large mug, slowly add the 7-up (or Sprite).

Rum Sour.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

Rum Toddy.strInstructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in water in an old-fashioned glass. Add rum and one ice cube and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

Rum Punch.strInstructions: Mix all ingredients in a punch bowl and serve.

Royal Fizz.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except cola) with ice and strain into a chilled collins glass. Fill with cola and serve.

Rum Cooler.strInstructions: Pour the rum and soda into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon wedge.

Rusty Nail.strInstructions: Pour the Scotch and Drambuie into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon twist.

Rum Runner.strInstructions: Mix all ingredients in glass & add ice.

Rum Cobbler.strInstructions: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the rum. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.

Red Snapper.strInstructions: One shot each, shake n shoot

Royal Flush.strInstructions: Pour all the ingredients into tumbler over ice. Strain into glass.

Royal Bitch.strInstructions: Into a shot glass layer the Crown Royal on top of the Frangelico.

Ruby Tuesday.strInstructions: Pour gin and cranberry into a highball filled with ice cubes. Add grenadine and stir.

Rosemary Blue.strInstructions:
1) Add the Bombay Sapphire, Blue Curacao, rosemary sprig and gently squeezed lemon wedge to a balloon glass. Swirl well to combine.
2) Fill with cubed ice and top with the Fever-Tree Light Tonic Water.
3) Gently fold with a bar spoon to mix.

Royal Gin Fizz.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

Rum Milk Punch.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

Rum Screwdriver.strInstructions: Pour rum into a highball glass over ice cubes. Add orange juice, stir, and serve.

Raspberry Cooler.strInstructions: Pour the raspberry vodka and soda into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

Rum Old-fashioned.strInstructions: Stir powdered sugar, water, and bitters in an old-fashioned glass. When sugar has dissolved add ice cubes and light rum. Add the twist of lime peel, float 151 proof rum on top, and serve.

Russian Spring Punch.strInstructions: Pour the ingredients into an highball glass, top with Sparkling wine.

Radioactive Long Island Iced Tea.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients over ice in a very tall glass. Sip cautiously.

Smut.strInstructions: Throw it all together and serve real cold.

Spritz.strInstructions: Build into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

Sazerac.strInstructions: Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice, and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice and set it aside. Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, and strain the drink into the glass. Add the lemon peel for garnish.

Scooter.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Sidecar.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass.

Stinger.strInstructions: Pour in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into a cocktail glass. May also be served on rocks in a rocks glass.

Snowball.strInstructions: Place one ice cube in the glass and add 1 1/2 oz of Advocaat. Fill up the glass with lemonade and decorate with a slice of lemon. Serve at once.

Shot-gun.strInstructions: Pour one part Jack Daneils and one part Jim Beam into shot glass then float Wild Turkey on top.

Spice 75.strInstructions:
Gently warm 60g golden caster sugar in a pan with 30ml water and 1 tbsp allspice. Cook gently until the sugar has dissolved, then leave the mixture to cool. Strain through a sieve lined with a coffee filter (or a double layer of kitchen paper).

Pour 60ml of the spiced syrup into a cocktail shaker along with 200ml rum and 90ml lime juice. Shake with ice and strain between six flute glasses. Top up with 600ml champagne and garnish each with an orange twist.

Salty Dog.strInstructions: Pour all ingredients over ice cubes in a highball glass. Stir well and serve. (Vodka may be substituted for gin, if preferred.)

Stone Sour.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled whiskey sour glass, and serve.

Sangria #1.strInstructions: Mix all together in a pitcher and refrigerate. Add cloves and cinnamon sticks to taste. Serve in wine glasses.

Sea breeze.strInstructions: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

Scotch Sour.strInstructions: Shake scotch, juice of lime, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with 1/2 slice lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

Screwdriver.strInstructions: Mix in a highball glass with ice. Garnish and serve.

Sherry Flip.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

Sweet Tooth.strInstructions: Put 2 shots Godiva Liquour into a glass, add as much or as little milk as you would like.

Sol Y Sombra.strInstructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a brandy snifter, and serve. (The English translation of the name of this drink is "Sun and Shade", and after sampling this drink, you'll understand why. Thanks, Kirby.)

Shark Attack.strInstructions: Mix lemonade and water according to instructions on back of can. If the instructions say to add 4 1/3 cans of water do so. Mix into pitcher. Add 1 1/2 cup of Vodka (Absolut). Mix well. Pour into glass of crushed ice. Excellent!

Sherry Eggnog.strInstructions: Shake sherry, powdered sugar, and egg with ice and strain into a collins glass. Fill with milk and stir. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

Sweet Sangria.strInstructions: Dissolve the sugar in hot water and cool. Peel the citrus fruits and break into wedges. Mix the wine, sugar syrup, fruit, and Fresca in a pitcher and put in the fridge for a few hours. Serve in tall glasses with a straw.

San Francisco.strInstructions: Take a tall glass and put in a few ice cubes, fill the vodka over it and fill with juice then the "creme", to end fill in the grenadine but very carefully at the side of the glass so it will lay down in the bottom. garnish with orange and strawberry.

Space Odyssey.strInstructions: Fill glass with ice and add shots of Bacardi and Malibu. Add splash of pineapple juice and top with orange juice. Add grenadine for color and garnish with cherries.

Scotch Cobbler.strInstructions: Pour scotch, brandy, and curacao over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Add the orange slice, top with the mint sprig, and serve.

Thriller.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

Tia-Maria.strInstructions: Boil water, sugar and coffe for 10 mins and let cool. Add rum and vanilla. Put in clean bottle(s) and leave for 1 week before using.

Tipperary.strInstructions: Stir over ice. Strain into chilled glass. Cut a wide swath of orange peel, and express the orange oils over the drink. Discard orange twist.

Turkeyball.strInstructions: Shake with ice and strain into a shot glass.

Tom Collins.strInstructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass alomst filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.

Texas Sling.strInstructions: Blend with Ice until smooth. Serve in a tulip glass, top with whip cream.

Tequila Fizz.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except ginger ale) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.

Tequila Sour.strInstructions: Shake tequila, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the half-slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

Talos Coffee.strInstructions: Add your GM and then add your coffee.

Tennesee Mud.strInstructions: Mix Coffee, Jack Daniels and Amaretto. Add Cream on top.

Turf Cocktail.strInstructions: Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

The Last Word.strInstructions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

The Laverstoke.strInstructions:
1) Squeeze two lime wedges into a balloon glass then add the cordial, Bombay Sapphire and MARTINI Rosso Vermouth, swirl to mix.

2) Fully fill the glass with cubed ice and stir to chill.

3) Top with Fever-Tree Ginger Ale and gently stir again to combine.

4) Garnish with a snapped ginger slice and an awoken mint sprig.

Tuxedo Cocktail.strInstructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry and a twist of lemon zest.

Tequila Sunrise.strInstructions: Pour the tequila and orange juice into glass over ice. Add the grenadine, which will sink to the bottom. Stir gently to create the sunrise effect. Garnish and serve.

Tequila Slammer.strInstructions: Mix carefully to avoid releasing the dissolved CO2.

Tequila Surprise.strInstructions: Fill shot glass with Tequila. Add drops of Tobasco sauce.

The Jimmy Conway.strInstructions:
Fill glass with ice
Pour in The Irishman and Disaronno
Fill to the top with Cranberry Juice
Garnish with a slice of lemon…Enjoy!

Texas Rattlesnake.strInstructions: Mix all ingredients and Shake well. Sweet at first, with a BITE at the end...

Tommy's Margarita.strInstructions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

The Evil Blue Thing.strInstructions: Pour ingredients into glass, and drop in a blue whale! The blue whale isn't really necessary, but it makes the drink more "fun".

Victor.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Vesper.strInstructions: Shake over ice until well chilled, then strain into a deep goblet and garnish with a thin slice of lemon peel.

Vesuvio.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

Veteran.strInstructions: Pour the rum and cherry brandy into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

Vampiro.strInstructions: Vampiros may be made in a tall glass or an old fashioned glass. Bartenders may first "rim" the glass with Kosher Salt, which is done by placing a layer of Kosher Salt on a chopping board, moistening the glass' rim with lime juice or water, and then placing the upside down glass rim onto the Kosher Salt, so that the salt sticks to the moistened rim. The second step is to fill half the glass with ice and add one or two shooter glasses full of high quality Tequila. The next stage is to add the flavouring elements. This is done by squeezing a fresh lime into the glass, adding a few grains of salt, adding citrus-flavoured soda pop, until the glass is 4/5 full, and then adding spicy Viuda de Sanchez (or orange juice, lime juice and pico de gallo). The final step is to stir the ingredients so that the flavours are properly blended.

Van Vleet.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

Vodka Fizz.strInstructions: Blend all ingredients, save nutmeg. Pour into large white wine glass and sprinkle nutmeg on top.

Vodka Martini.strInstructions: Shake the vodka and vermouth together with a number of ice cubes, strain into a cocktail glass, add the olive and serve.

Vodka Russian.strInstructions: Mix it as a ordinary drink .

Vermouth Cassis.strInstructions: Stir vermouth and creme de cassis in a highball glass with ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir again, and serve.

Victory Collins.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.

Vodka And Tonic.strInstructions: Pour vodka into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with tonic water, stir, and serve.

Valencia Cocktail.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Whisky Mac.strInstructions: Pour both of the ingredients into a wine goblet with no ice.

Wine Punch.strInstructions: Combine all of the ingredients and pour over a block of ice.

White Lady.strInstructions: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into large cocktail glass.

Wine Cooler.strInstructions: Mix wine and soft drink. Pour into glass. Add ice.

Whiskey Sour.strInstructions: Shake with ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve. If served 'On the rocks', strain ingredients into old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

White Russian.strInstructions: Pour vodka and coffee liqueur over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Fill with light cream and serve.

Whitecap Margarita.strInstructions: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. This makes one drink.

Waikiki Beachcomber.strInstructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

Yellow Bird.strInstructions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass

Zorro.strInstructions: add all and pour black coffee and add whipped cream on top.

Zinger.strInstructions: Get a shot glass and pour in three shots of the schnapps. Do the same with the Surge Cola. Then down it like Scheetz would.

Zoksel.strInstructions: No specific mixinginstructions, just poor every ingredient in one glass. The lemon goes with it.

Zombie.strInstructions:
Blend at high speed for no more than 5 seconds.

Pour into a glass, add ice cubes to fill, then add the garnish.

*Donn’s mix: Bring 3 crushed cinnamon sticks, 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water to a boil, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.

Simmer for 2 minutes, then remove from the heat and let sit for at least 2 hours before straining into a clean glass bottle.

Then add 1 part of the syrup and 2 parts of fresh grapefruit juice together.

Zambeer.strInstructions: Mix sambuca with rootbeer and stir. Add ice

Zorbatini.strInstructions: Prepare like a Martini. Garnish with a green olive.

Zipperhead.strInstructions: Fill glass with rocks, add straw before putting in liquor. Then add the ingredients in order, trying to keep layered as much as possible (i.e. Chambord on bottom, then Vodka, Then soda on top).

Zima Blaster.strInstructions: Fill glass with ice. Pour in Chambord, then fill with Zima. Mix and enjoy.

Zizi Coin-coin.strInstructions: Pour 5cl of Cointreau on ice, add 2cl of fresh lemon (or lime) juice, stir gently, and finally add slices of lemon/lime in glass.

Zippy's Revenge.strInstructions: Mix Kool-Aid to taste then add Rum and ammaretto. shake well to disolve the sugar in the Kool-Aid... serve cold

Zimadori Zinger.strInstructions: Pour Zima in a collins glass over ice and then pour the shot of Midori. Don't stir. Garnish with a cherry.

Ziemes Martini Apfelsaft.strInstructions: Serve without ice. At least the juice shold have room temperature.

Bourbon Lemonade.strInstructions: Serve without ice. At least the juice shold have room temperature.
